Title: Fashion, Creativity, Culture, and Connection at EWA2025
Summary: Entertainment Week Africa (EWA) showcased creativity across multiple sectors, from fashion to film, music, tech, and more . The six-day festival brought together artists, entrepreneurs, and industry figures from across the continent .

Title: Parents accuse Niger govt of inaction over abducted pupils
Summary: Parents of students abducted from St. Mary Catholic School, Papiri, in Agwara Local Government Area, Niger State, staged a protest on Saturday . They allege government negligence in securing the release of their children and teachers . The pupils and staff have been abducted .

Title: Protest held in Madrid over kidnappings of Nigerian schoolchildren
Summary: Hundreds of demonstrators gathered outside the Nigerian embassy in Madrid on Saturday . Demonstrators expressed concern over recent attacks and kidnappings of schoolchildren in Nigeria . The protest followed the abduction of more than 250 students from a Catholic school in northern Nigeria .

Title: EkoDubai launches in Lagos, bridging Nigerian investors to Dubai’s property market
Summary: EkoDubai is a new real estate company established to bridge the gap between Nigerian investors and Dubai property market . Lagos played host to the official unveiling of the company on Sunday . The launch gathered an impressive blend of investors and property developers .

Title: FUL Teaching Hospital, NIPRD partner to advance vaccine studies
Summary: Federal University Lafia Teaching Hospital (FULTH) signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the National Institute of Pharmaceutical Research and Development (NIPRD) on vaccine research and development . The signing of the MoU was chaired by Prof. Ali Pate .

Title: Bandits demand N150 ransom to release Kwara monarch
Summary: Oba Ojibara was asked by the bandits to speak with members of his community so they would believe he was in their custody .

Title: Asake’s Lagos concert faces backlash as ₦300k ticket price sparks fan outrage
Summary: Asake's Lagos concert faces backlash as ₦300k ticket price sparks fan outrage . Ásake’s much-anticipated homecoming concert may be heading into stormy waters . Fans take to social media to criticise the staggering ticket fee .

Title: I’ve only dated older men — Seyi Hunter
Summary: Nollywood actress, filmmaker and fast-rising adult-lifestyle entrepreneur Seyi Hunter opens up about her personal life, career evolution, and philosophy guiding her next big moves . Hunter does so with a characteristic mix of humor, honesty and audacity .

Title: Shirley Igwe reacts as AGN lifts suspension, pledges professionalism
Summary: Shirley Igwe has expressed relief and gratitude following the decision of the Actors Guild of Nigeria (AGN) to lift the suspension earlier placed on her after a July 19 incident on a Lagos movie set . The actress said she was relieved and thanked the Guild for lifting the suspension .

Title: Troops quell communal violence, neutralize four armed militias in Taraba
Summary: Troops quell communal violence, neutralize four armed militias in Taraba . Members of the public encouraged to report any suspicious movements or activities to the nearest security formation .

Title: Police bust suspected cult group in Sokoto
Summary: The Sokoto State Police Command has dismantled a suspected cult network known as “Sai Malam” and uncovered a WhatsApp-based recruitment channel used to lure young people into the group . Three suspects, including the alleged coordinator, Usman Shu’aibu, were arrested late Friday during a sting operation carried out by the

Title: NELFUND disburses N140bn in student loans to 788,000
Summary: The Nigerian Education Loan Fund said it has disbursed N140.9 billion in student loans to beneficiaries since the scheme’s portal was launched on May 24, 2024 . NELFUND has received 1,193,228 applications, of which 788,947 students have benefited from the programme .

Title: NDLEA intercepts illicit drugs hidden in cookies, teddy bears
Summary: National Drug Law Enforcement Agency have dismantled a social media–based drug distribution network . The syndicate allegedly imported consignments of Canadian Loud, a potent strain of cannabis, alongside colourful designer sachets branded with cookie and snack labels . The packaging, according to investigators, was used to disguise retail quantities of the psychoactive substance .

Title: Kebbi gov meets Tinubu after rescue of abducted schoolgirls
Summary: President Bola Tinubu on Saturday received Kebbi State Governor, Nasir Idris, at the State House, Abuja . The talks centred on the “successful rescue’ of students seized from Government Girls Comprehensive Secondary School, Maga, Danko-Wasagu LGA, on November 17 . The

Title: Justice remains crucial to governance, development, says Kano gov
Summary: Kano State Governor, Abba Kabir Yusuf, has reaffirmed that justice, fairness and accountability must remain the foundation of governance . He said the relationship between law and society becomes meaningful only when the justice system is accessible, effective and fair to all citizens . Yusuf said his administration had introduced sweeping reforms to tackle prolonged detention,
